medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The infant was admitted to the hospital on the second day of life due to persistent hypoglycemia that began immediately after birth. The blood glucose level was less than 10 mg per deciliter at birth, followed by fluctuating glucose levels ranging from 21 to 34 mg per deciliter over the first 14 hours, with seizures occurring at 14 hours of life.
medical_history.family_history: The infant had two normal siblings; the third sibling had cerebral palsy.
